content: Yes, Auguste Comte is attributed to the statement "The idea of rights should be completely wiped out" in some sources. Comte, a French philosopher who is widely regarded as the founder of the field of sociology, believed that social progress depended on the subordination of individual interests to the needs of the community. He argued that individual rights were a hindrance to social order and stability, and advocated for a society in which individual behavior was guided by a sense of duty to the collective.
